<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zhl5317>@zhl5317</denchmark-link> Sorry, what attachment do you mean?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zhl5317>@zhl5317</denchmark-link> Could you test LS release/0.7.4 now? Is your error still there?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zhl5317>@zhl5317</denchmark-link>
Why do you have doubled "completions" seсtions? <denchmark-code>completions: {   "completions": [ ... </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/makseq>@makseq</denchmark-link>
no, Just one example actually my completions is: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17403033/91372503-6058ab80-e846-11ea-8420-5e9c1f440f36.png></denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hlomzik>@hlomzik</denchmark-link> Can you check this issue about canvas: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/niklasvh/html2canvas/issues/1859>niklasvh/html2canvas#1859</denchmark-link>
It seems really something strange in it...
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zhl5317>@zhl5317</denchmark-link> do you have this trouble in the each task?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/makseq>@makseq</denchmark-link>
no， other image tagging task are all ok， only “object detection“ have this trouble

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zhl5317>@zhl5317</denchmark-link> I explored your completion more detailed and found that there is "ellipselabels" inside, but you are talking about bboxes. I think you broke the integrity somewhere between the labeling config and task completions, e.g. you changed the labeling config manually.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/makseq>@makseq</denchmark-link>
thank you for your attention actually, i think my data is ok, because the data is created by LS tagging, not created by by myself. the following pic is my test data <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17403033/91790606-cb89ef80-ec43-11ea-8302-dbeb05369a1f.png></denchmark-link>
{ "completions": [ { "created_at": 1598929260, "id": 1001, "lead_time": 4.093, "result": [ { "from_name": "label", "id": "f2I9aRX-3x", "image_rotation": 0, "original_height": 403, "original_width": 600, "parent_id": null, "source": "$image", "to_name": "image", "type": "rectanglelabels", "value": { "height": 56.96517412935324, "rectanglelabels": [ "Airplane" ], "rotation": 0, "width": 22.666666666666668, "x": 39.333333333333336, "y": 31.8407960199005 } } ] } ], "data": { "image": "https://app.heartex.ai/static/samples/sample.jpg" }, "id": 1 } you can try "Bbox object detection" in your side to check whether has the issue
I checked your completion on my side. Everything is ok... Do you use google chrome? Or some custom version of it?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/makseq>@makseq</denchmark-link>
yes, im using chrome, Is there a compatibility issue on Chrome?
Maybe. I'm trying to do some checks. Can you try another browser? And please show your label config.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/makseq>@makseq</denchmark-link>
anyway, thank you for your quick reply, i will track my configrations in more detail, and i will try on other another browser mysql label config is official website example <View> <Image name="image" value="$image"/> <RectangleLabels name="label" toName="image"> <Label value="Airplane" background="green"/> <Label value="Car" background="blue"/> </RectangleLabels> </View> I will give you feedback on any discovery， one more thanks

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/makseq>@makseq</denchmark-link>
i try on other browser (ie Edge) is ok, but on chrome sometimes is ok, sometime will occurs " Failed to execute 'drawImage' on 'CanvasRenderingContext2D': The image argument is a canvas element with a width or height of 0", its very strange <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17403033/91938127-fba9bf00-ed25-11ea-8c2d-7d445f1645af.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17403033/91938079-e5036800-ed25-11ea-8067-823534d5b095.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zhl5317>@zhl5317</denchmark-link> Do you still have this issue? Can you try release 0.7.5rc3? (it's in pypi: pip install label-studio==0.7.4rc3)
I faced this issue. The problem could be in the too small area where LSF is placed. Try to pre-define it at least with width=500px.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zhl5317>@zhl5317</denchmark-link> Does it help you?

I faced this issue. The problem could be in the too small area where LSF is placed. Try to pre-define it at least with width=500px.
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/makseq>@makseq</denchmark-link> ! I also faced this issue. Where can i pre-define the LSF area width?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/korotaS>@korotaS</denchmark-link> Hi, I hope we fixed it since 0.7.5.post0 release. Check this release, please.
